article.headline: Ball State 65, Prairie View A&M 48
article.story: MUNCIE, Ind. (AP) -- D'Andre Peyton scored eight of his 13 points in a 15-0 second-half run that carried Ball State to a 65-48 victory over Prairie View on Sunday. Jalon Perryman and Steve Horton also had 13 points each for the Cardinals (2-0), whose lead never dropped below 11 points after that. Prairie View (1-2) led by three points in the first half. Ball State went up 28-27 at halftime, but the Panthers regained the lead for the last time at 33-32 after consecutive baskets by Jared Ellison and Ivory McGilvery early in the second period. A basket by Micah Rollin put Ball State back in the lead and started the long run that put the Cardinals in control. The Panthers had five turnovers and were scoreless the next six minutes as Ball State went ahead 47-33 before a layup by Andy Genao ended the streak. The Cardinals took their biggest lead at 53-35 on a dunk by Perryman with just over eight minutes remaining. Anthony Newell added 10 points for Ball State. Prairie View was led by Jonathon Dixon with nine points and Ellison with seven.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
